intro: Chiococca brachiata var. tenuifolia, commonly known as the slender-stemmed chiococca, is a climbing shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its botanical features include hairy stems and leaves with a distinctive lobed shape. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
